intro: Erica fastigiata var. longituba, commonly known as the narrow-leaved heath, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It is characterized by its upright growth habit and narrow, evergreen leaves that are typically glossy and dark green. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are usually pink or red, blooming in late summer to early autumn. It thrives in well-drained, acidic soils and requires full sun to partial shade. This variety is often cultivated for its ornamental value and ability to form dense, compact shrubs.
